job_description: UrtheCast was created around a unique vision: to provide the world’s first ever, near-real time HD video feed of Earth from space.  UrtheCast has built, launched, installed, and will be operating two cameras on the International Space Station. Starting in 2014, video of the Earth collected by our cameras will be down-linked to ground stations around the planet and then displayed in near-real time on the UrtheCast web platform and distributed directly to our exclusive partners and customers.On our Ground Segment team, we are searching for a Software Engineer Co-op who is looking to join a progressive and tech-savvy dream engineering team. The Software Engineer (Co-op) will be responsible for designing, implementing, testing and bug fixing various parts of the systems that comprise the Ground Segment, including converting the downlinked telemetry, image and video processing into finished products, and managing customer’s orders for these products.WORK ENVIRONMENT• Fast-paced, open-concept, constantly evolving• Work occasional overtimeWhat can we offer you?• Competitive compensation, full benefits and flexible time off• Great work environment, team and office location; right over the water in the new Vancouver Convention Centre• Great lunch programs will provide you with an opportunity to learn and socialize, and our Friday afternoons will set the right mood for the weekend!• Gym Membership• Fully loaded kitchen!We are an innovative organization and pride ourselves with a culture that embodies self-initiative, excellence, openness and collaboration, passion, and results-orientation. The work environment is characterized as fast-paced, lots of volume and ambiguity as we are growing and need processes to be put in place.To learn more about UrtheCast’s platform visit www.urthecast.com
job_requirements: You will have:• Completed at least 2 years of software/engineering/physics course work• Completed at least 2 Co-op terms• Experience developing software using LINUX is mandatory• Experience developing software using GIT for version control (GitFlow process a plus!)• Experience developing software using either Python, Java or C++• Completed Linear Algebra coursework• Good math and analytical skills• Enthusiasm for innovation in the tech industryBonus points for experience in any of these:• Advanced math• Physics, Optics, Remote Sensing, GIS, WebGIS• Matlab• AWS Cloud and front-end development (Javascript, Angular, Node, etc)• PostgreSQL, PostGIS, MongoDB• Relevant independent “on the side” projectsOpen To All Majors:No
